name: IOBluetoothDevicePair
desc: An instance of IOBluetoothDevicePair represents a pairing attempt to a remote Bluetooth device.

items.name: init!(device: IOBluetoothDevice!)
items.desc: Creates an autorelease IOBluetoothDevicePair object with a device as the pairing target.

items.name: func device() -> IOBluetoothDevice!
items.desc: Get the IOBluetoothDevice being used by the object.

items.name: func replyPINCode(Int, pinCode: UnsafeMutablePointer<BluetoothPINCode>!)
items.desc: This is the required reply to the devicePairingPINCodeRequest delegate message. Set the PIN code to use during pairing if required.

items.name: func replyUserConfirmation(Bool)
items.desc: This is the required reply to the devicePairingUserConfirmationRequest delegate message.

items.name: func setDevice(IOBluetoothDevice!)
items.desc: Set the device object to pair with. It is retained by the object.

items.name: func start() -> IOReturn
items.desc: Kicks off the pairing with the device.

items.name: func stop()
items.desc: Stops the current pairing. Removes the delegate and disconnects if device was connected.
